member.name: E:ReactiveSockets.IReactiveSocket.Connected
member.summary: Raised when the socket is connected.

member.name: E:ReactiveSockets.IReactiveSocket.Disconnected
member.summary: Raised when the socket is disconnected.

member.name: E:ReactiveSockets.IReactiveSocket.Disposed
member.summary: Raised when the socket is disposed.

member.name: P:ReactiveSockets.IReactiveSocket.IsConnected
member.summary: Gets whether the socket is connected.

member.name: P:ReactiveSockets.IReactiveSocket.Receiver
member.summary: Observable bytes that are being received by this endpoint. Note that subscribing to the receiver blocks until a byte is received, so subscribers will typically use the extension method SubscribeOn to specify the scheduler to use for subscription.
member.remarks: This blocking characteristic also propagates to higher level channels built on top of this socket, but it's not necessary to use SubscribeOn at more than one level.

member.name: P:ReactiveSockets.IReactiveSocket.Sender
member.summary: Observable bytes that are being sent through this endpoint by using the or methods. Non-blocking.

member.name: M:ReactiveSockets.IReactiveClient.ConnectAsync
member.summary: Attempts to connect to a server.

member.name: M:ReactiveSockets.IReactiveClient.Disconnect
member.summary: Disconnects the underlying connection to the server.

member.name: T:ReactiveSockets.IReactiveListener
member.summary: Interface implemented by the reactive listeners which can accept incoming connections.

member.name: M:ReactiveSockets.IReactiveListener.Dispose
member.summary: Disposes the listener, releasing all resources and closing any active connections.

member.name: M:ReactiveSockets.IReactiveListener.Start
member.summary: Starts accepting connections.

member.name: P:ReactiveSockets.IReactiveListener.Connections
member.summary: Observable connections that are being accepted by the listener.

member.name: T:ReactiveSockets.ISocketExtensions
member.summary: Provides easy configuration of socket options via properties.

member.name: M:ReactiveSockets.ISocketExtensions.IpOptions(ReactiveSockets.ISocket)
member.summary: Retrieves the IP options available for the socket.

member.name: T:ReactiveSockets.ISocketExtensions.ISocketOptions
member.summary: Exposes the well-known options that can be set for a socket.

member.name: P:ReactiveSockets.ISocketExtensions.ISocketOptions.DontFragment
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that specifies whether the allows Internet Protocol (IP) datagrams to be fragmented.
member.returns: true if the allows datagram fragmentation; otherwise, false. The default is true.

member.name: P:ReactiveSockets.ISocketExtensions.ISocketOptions.EnableBroadcast
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that specifies whether the can send or receive broadcast packets.
member.returns: true if the allows broadcast packets; otherwise, false. The default is false.

member.name: P:ReactiveSockets.ISocketExtensions.ISocketOptions.ExclusiveAddressUse
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that specifies whether the allows only one process to bind to a port.
member.returns: true if the allows only one socket to bind to a specific port; otherwise, false. The default is true for Windows Server 2003 and Windows XP Service Pack 2, and false for all other versions.

member.name: P:ReactiveSockets.ISocketExtensions.ISocketOptions.LingerState
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that specifies whether the will delay closing a socket in an attempt to send all pending data.
member.returns: A that specifies how to linger while closing a socket.

member.name: P:ReactiveSockets.ISocketExtensions.ISocketOptions.MulticastLoopback
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that specifies whether outgoing multicast packets are delivered to the sending application.
member.returns: true if the receives outgoing multicast packets; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:ReactiveSockets.ISocketExtensions.ISocketOptions.NoDelay
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that specifies whether the stream is using the Nagle algorithm.
member.returns: false if the uses the Nagle algorithm; otherwise, true. The default is false.

member.name: P:ReactiveSockets.ISocketExtensions.ISocketOptions.ReceiveBufferSize
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that specifies the size of the receive buffer of the .
member.returns: An that contains the size, in bytes, of the receive buffer. The default is 8192.

member.name: P:ReactiveSockets.ISocketExtensions.ISocketOptions.ReceiveTimeout
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that specifies the amount of time after which a synchronous call will time out.
member.returns: The time-out value, in milliseconds. The default value is 0, which indicates an infinite time-out period. Specifying -1 also indicates an infinite time-out period.

member.name: P:ReactiveSockets.ISocketExtensions.ISocketOptions.SendBufferSize
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that specifies the size of the send buffer of the .
member.returns: An that contains the size, in bytes, of the send buffer. The default is 8192.

member.name: P:ReactiveSockets.ISocketExtensions.ISocketOptions.SendTimeout
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that specifies the amount of time after which a synchronous call will time out.
member.returns: The time-out value, in milliseconds. If you set the property with a value between 1 and 499, the value will be changed to 500. The default value is 0, which indicates an infinite time-out period. Specifying -1 also indicates an infinite time-out period.

member.name: P:ReactiveSockets.ISocketExtensions.ISocketOptions.Ttl
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that specifies the Time To Live (TTL) value of Internet Protocol (IP) packets sent by the .
